item.description:
http://www.bostonharborislands.org/event-details?rid=1592

Explore the winter wonderland of Georges Island.

Looking for adventure during February vacation? Look no further. Come check out Georges Island in the winter! If it gets too cold outdoors, warm up in the brand new Visitor Center, and enjoy a short film as well as the exhibits about the island's history.

You can depart from either Long Wharf, Boston, 

 Remember to arrive at the dock at least 20 minutes early to allow time for boarding.

Long Wharf, Boston: Depart at 11:00 AM, return at 2:00 PM.

 



When

  • 2/26/2011 Sat @ Sierra Club Outing participants meet at 10:30am at Starbucks

 

Where:  Georges Island, get there via a boat from the Long Wharf, the Long Wharf is accessible via the Blue Line (aquarium stop)

 

Program Fee

$14

 

 

Tickets include a complimentary beverage. Reservations are strongly recommended as space is limited. Special rates for non-profit groups and clubs. Reservation Contact Information Boston's Best Cruises Reservations (617) 770-0040 RESERVE NOW Program Contact Information Park Ranger boha_information@nps.gov (617) 223-8666 Directions Boats will depart from Long Wharf, Boston and Quincy Shipyard. Check the event description for the schedule. Getting to the event - more info

 

Sponsor:  Boston Harbor Island Alliance

 

Additional Sponsor(s):  Department of Conservation and Recreation, National Park Service, and Boston's Best Cruises

 

  All ages $14.00
item.why: It's a great way to visit one of the many Boston Harbor Islands, History and Nature, and a boat ride

group.name: Greater Boston Sierra Club Environmental Meetup Group

item.name: George's Island Winter Fortress Exploration
